intro: Rubus sozostylus, commonly known as the red-haired blackberry, is a species of bramble native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is characterized by its dark purple to black berries, which are typically small and have a tart flavor. The plant has thorny stems and compound leaves with three to five leaflets. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. The flowers are white and appear in clusters, followed by the edible fruits that ripen in late summer.
